*** Submitted as http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?r=88008cf9d136 ***

net/http: fix trivial example server

R=golang-dev, r, r
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/5479061

Committer: Rob Pike <r@golang.org>

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com (cc: golang-dev@googlegroups.com),

I'd like you to review this change to
https://go.googlecode.com/hg/

LGTM

apologies; my copy of CONTRIBUTORS was old and you went in very recently.

On Dec 11, 2011, at 8:08 AM, duperray.olivier@gmail.com wrote:

> 
> On 2011/12/11 15:46:58, r2 wrote:
>> Thanks for catching this. Since you're not registered as a contributor
> and this
>> is such a trivial change, is it OK if I just apply it myself? If you
> want to be
>> a contributor that's great too, but you'll need to follow the steps
> listed at
>> doc/contribute.html.
> 
>> Let me know.
> 
> I did a small fix  :
> http://codereview.appspot.com/5450115/
> see
> http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?name=290ad29728fa&r=d8f16dcb1c00ad775c1f0e9992fc3cf1dc39445d
> please
> 
>> Thanks again.
> 
>> -rob

That is from someone calling themselves dupoxy, and is also not in the CONTRIBUTORS list. Let's get this sorted.

-rob

http://codereview.appspot.com/user/dupoxy = Olivier Duperray <duperray.olivier@gmail.com> in CONTRIBUTORS
dupoxy is the "nick name" in codereview I guess

On 2011/12/11 15:46:58, r2 wrote:
> Thanks for catching this. Since you're not registered as a contributor and this
> is such a trivial change, is it OK if I just apply it myself? If you want to be
> a contributor that's great too, but you'll need to follow the steps listed at
> doc/contribute.html.
> 
> Let me know.

I did a small fix  :
http://codereview.appspot.com/5450115/
see
http://code.google.com/p/go/source/detail?name=290ad29728fa&r=d8f16dcb1c00ad775c1f0e9992fc3cf1dc39445d
please

> Thanks again.

Thanks for catching this. Since you're not registered as a contributor and this is such a trivial change, is it OK if I just apply it myself? If you want to be a contributor that's great too, but you'll need to follow the steps listed at doc/contribute.html.

Let me know.

Thanks again.

-rob
